Cleaning out the email box...

	Dean-
Not sure if anyone answered this question. You might look into to  
Tosu, there should be some online sources and I believe that while  
these "utility knives" influenced the early development of the the  
sword, they also never really went out of style and simply evolved  
into the kogatana/kozuka we know from later periods...
MHO
-t

On Dec 19, 2005, at 6:17 AM, Dean Wayland wrote:

> H All,
>
> Were kodzuka ever supplied with a saya of their own? If so, what form
> did it take? Or, were these utility knives never carried  
> independent of
> wakizashi/katana saya?
>
> Yours
>
> Dean
